verses.verse: A Psalm of <S%H1732>David<s%>. <S%H7378>Plead<s%> my cause, O <S%H3068>LORD<s%>, with them that <S%H3401>strive<s%> with me: <S%H3898>fight<s%> against them that <S%H3898>fight<s%> against me.
Take <S%H2388>hold<s%> of <S%H4043>shield<s%> and <S%H6793>buckler<s%>, and stand <S%H6965>up<s%> for mine <S%H5833>help<s%>.

Draw <S%H7324>out<s%> also the <S%H2595>spear<s%>, and <S%H5462>stop<s%> the way <S%H7125>against<s%> them that <S%H7291>persecute<s%> me: <S%H559>say<s%> unto my <S%H5315>soul<s%>, I am thy <S%H3444>salvation<s%>.

Let them be <S%H954>confounded<s%> and put to <S%H3637>shame<s%> that <S%H1245>seek<s%> after my <S%H5315>soul<s%>: let them be <S%H5472>turned<s%> <S%H268>back<s%> and brought to <S%H2659>confusion<s%> that <S%H2803>devise<s%> my <S%H7451>hurt<s%>.
Let them be as <S%H4671>chaff<s%> <S%H6440>before<s%> the <S%H7307>wind<s%>: and let the <S%H4397>angel<s%> of the <S%H3068>LORD<s%> <S%H1760>chase<s%> them.
Let their <S%H1870>way<s%> be <S%H2822>dark<s%> and <S%H2519>slippery<s%>: and let the <S%H4397>angel<s%> of the <S%H3068>LORD<s%> <S%H7291>persecute<s%> them. dark: Heb. darkness and slipperiness
For without <S%H2600>cause<s%> have they <S%H2934>hid<s%> for me their <S%H7568>net<s%> in a <S%H7845>pit<s%>, which without <S%H2600>cause<s%> they have <S%H2658>digged<s%> for my <S%H5315>soul<s%>.

Let <S%H7722>destruction<s%> <S%H935>come<s%> upon him at <S%H3045>unawares<s%> <S%H3808><s%>; and let his <S%H7568>net<s%> that he hath <S%H2934>hid<s%> <S%H3920>catch<s%> himself: into that very <S%H7722>destruction<s%> let him <S%H5307>fall<s%>. at: Heb. which he knoweth not of
And my <S%H5315>soul<s%> shall be <S%H1523>joyful<s%> in the <S%H3068>LORD<s%>: it shall <S%H7797>rejoice<s%> in his <S%H3444>salvation<s%>.

All my <S%H6106>bones<s%> shall <S%H559>say<s%>, <S%H3068>LORD<s%>, who is like unto thee, which <S%H5337>deliverest<s%> the <S%H6041>poor<s%> from him that is too <S%H2389>strong<s%> for him, yea, the <S%H6041>poor<s%> and the <S%H34>needy<s%> from him that <S%H1497>spoileth<s%> him?
<S%H2555>False<s%> <S%H5707>witnesses<s%> did rise <S%H6965>up<s%>; they laid to my <S%H7592>charge<s%> things that I <S%H3045>knew<s%> not. False: Heb. Witnesses of wrong they: Heb. they asked me
They <S%H7999>rewarded<s%> me <S%H7451>evil<s%> for <S%H2896>good<s%> to the <S%H7908>spoiling<s%> of my <S%H5315>soul<s%>. spoiling: Heb. depriving

But as for me, when they were <S%H2470>sick<s%>, my <S%H3830>clothing<s%> was <S%H8242>sackcloth<s%>: I <S%H6031>humbled<s%> my <S%H5315>soul<s%> with <S%H6685>fasting<s%>; and my <S%H8605>prayer<s%> <S%H7725>returned<s%> into mine own <S%H2436>bosom<s%>. humbled: or, afflicted

I <S%H1980>behaved<s%> myself as though he had been my <S%H7453>friend<s%> or <S%H251>brother<s%>: I bowed <S%H7817>down<s%> <S%H6937>heavily<s%>, as one that <S%H57>mourneth<s%> for his <S%H517>mother<s%>. behaved myself: Heb. walked as though: Heb. as a friend, as a brother to me

But in mine <S%H6761>adversity<s%> they <S%H8055>rejoiced<s%>, and gathered themselves <S%H622>together<s%>: yea, the <S%H5222>abjects<s%> gathered themselves <S%H622>together<s%> against me, and I <S%H3045>knew<s%> it not; they did <S%H7167>tear<s%> me, and <S%H1826>ceased<s%> not: adversity: Heb. halting
With <S%H2611>hypocritical<s%> <S%H3934>mockers<s%> in <S%H4580>feasts<s%>, they <S%H2786>gnashed<s%> upon me with their <S%H8127>teeth<s%>.

<S%H136>Lord<s%>, how long wilt thou look <S%H7200>on<s%>? <S%H7725>rescue<s%> my <S%H5315>soul<s%> from their <S%H7722>destructions<s%>, my <S%H3173>darling<s%> from the <S%H3715>lions<s%>. darling: Heb. only one
I will give thee <S%H3034>thanks<s%> in the <S%H7227>great<s%> <S%H6951>congregation<s%>: I will <S%H1984>praise<s%> thee among <S%H6099>much<s%> <S%H5971>people<s%>. much: Heb. strong

Let not them that are mine <S%H341>enemies<s%> <S%H8267>wrongfully<s%> <S%H8055>rejoice<s%> over me: neither let them <S%H7169>wink<s%> with the <S%H5869>eye<s%> that <S%H8130>hate<s%> me without a <S%H2600>cause<s%>. wrongfully: Heb. falsely
For they <S%H1696>speak<s%> not <S%H7965>peace<s%>: but they <S%H2803>devise<s%> <S%H4820>deceitful<s%> <S%H1697>matters<s%> against them that are <S%H7282>quiet<s%> in the <S%H776>land<s%>.
Yea, they opened their <S%H6310>mouth<s%> <S%H7337>wide<s%> against me, and <S%H559>said<s%>, <S%H1889>Aha<s%>, <S%H1889>aha<s%>, our <S%H5869>eye<s%> hath <S%H7200>seen<s%> it.
This thou hast <S%H7200>seen<s%>, O <S%H3068>LORD<s%>: keep not <S%H2790>silence<s%>: O <S%H136>Lord<s%>, be not <S%H7368>far<s%> from me.
Stir <S%H5782>up<s%> thyself, and <S%H6974>awake<s%> to my <S%H4941>judgment<s%>, even unto my <S%H7379>cause<s%>, my <S%H430>God<s%> and my <S%H136>Lord<s%>.
<S%H8199>Judge<s%> me, O <S%H3068>LORD<s%> my <S%H430>God<s%>, according to thy <S%H6664>righteousness<s%>; and let them not <S%H8055>rejoice<s%> over me.

Let them not <S%H559>say<s%> in their <S%H3820>hearts<s%>, <S%H1889>Ah<s%>, so would we have <S%H5315>it<s%>: let them not <S%H559>say<s%>, We have swallowed him <S%H1104>up<s%>. Ah: Heb. Ah, ah, our soul

Let them be <S%H954>ashamed<s%> and brought to <S%H2659>confusion<s%> <S%H3162>together<s%> that <S%H8056>rejoice<s%> at mine <S%H7451>hurt<s%>: let them be <S%H3847>clothed<s%> with <S%H1322>shame<s%> and <S%H3639>dishonour<s%> that <S%H1431>magnify<s%> themselves against me.

Let them shout for <S%H7442>joy<s%>, and be <S%H8055>glad<s%>, that <S%H2655>favour<s%> my righteous <S%H6664>cause<s%>: yea, let them <S%H559>say<s%> <S%H8548>continually<s%>, Let the <S%H3068>LORD<s%> be <S%H1431>magnified<s%>, which hath <S%H2655>pleasure<s%> in the <S%H7965>prosperity<s%> of his <S%H5650>servant<s%>. righteous: Heb. righteousness
And my <S%H3956>tongue<s%> shall <S%H1897>speak<s%> of thy <S%H6664>righteousness<s%> and of thy <S%H8416>praise<s%> all the <S%H3117>day<s%> long.
